intro: Baissea welwitschii, commonly known as the Welwitschii mountain cucumber, is a unique plant native to the Namib Desert in Namibia. It is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and gourds, and is characterized by its climbing habit and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers and elongated fruits that can grow up to 3 meters in length. It is adapted to extreme arid conditions, with deep roots that allow it to access underground water sources. Baissea welwitschii is also notable for being one of the oldest known plant species, with a lineage dating back over 100 million years.
